newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Tupperware seen tumbling.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Tupperware seen tumbling.

text.p: Tupperware Corp shares were widely for sale preceding the U.S. market open as investors soured on the company after it warned last night of a decline in first quarter income, trader said.
Ahead of the opening bell, traders said Tupperware shares were offered at 39, off 5-1/8 from the last New York Stock Exchange trade yesterday.
After the market close last night, Tupperware said it expects lower first quarter net income compared with last year based on lower than expected sales and the impact of unfavorable foreign exchange.

Tupperware reported proforma 1996 operating earnings per share of $0.46 in the first quarter, $0.77 a share in the second and $2.79 for the year. The company was spun off from Premark International Inc in May 1996.

Analysts had expected the company to earn $0.51 a share in the first quarter, $0.86 a share in the second quarter and $3.05 a share for the year, according to First Call's consensus of analysts' earnings estimates.
Elsewhere, Conrail Inc climbed 1-3/8 to 113 after it was reported the railroad's board approved a plan to sell itself for $115 per share, or $10.5 billion.

CSX Corp, the buyer, added 1/4 to 49-1/4 ahead of the open, and shares in Norfolk Southern Corp -- the railroad battling CSX for Conrail and the expected buyer of different pieces of Conrail after the CSX acquisition -- were unmoved from their 93-7/8 closing price.

In other pre-open activity, Intel gained 3/4 to 146-5/8, Microsoft was off 1/4 to 99-1/4, MCI Communications rose 3/8 to 36, Baan Co N.V. American Depositary Receipts climbed 1-1/8 to 45-5/8, Cisco Systems Inc added 1/2 to 54-3/4, 3Com slipped 5/16 to 33-1/2 and U.S. Robotics climbed 1-1/8 to 56-1/8.
